author: Babayan-nawu
content: Good day my members of this community,I am interested in expanding my learning knowledge about Bitcoin and looking for ways on how it being obtain. Therefore, could more knowledgeable members of this great community reveal how.>>How does one get accurate and up to date information on Bitcoin news, research, and development?>> What is the best way to tell real news from fake news? >>Are there any specifics of obtaining bitcoin depending on the region/country? I am in need of detailed insights and practical instructions. Also want to know both theoretical and practical aspects of the issue. Thanks for your contribution and for enabling me to understand Bitcoin better.

comments.author: freedomgo
comments.body: Quote from: Babayan-nawu on October 21, 2024, 11:47:06 PM>>How does one get accurate and up to date information on Bitcoin news, research, and development?>> What is the best way to tell real news from fake news? Just focus on these news outlets as 99% of their reports are real. 1-CoinDesk2-CoinTelegraph3-Bitcoin Magazine4-https://decrypt.co/Quote>>Are there any specifics of obtaining bitcoin depending on the region/country? Sure, you can get Bitcoin as long as you’ve got the means. Just always keep your country’s Bitcoin regulations in mind. For example, if you’re in a place like China where Bitcoin trading is illegal, you’ve got to be careful not to get caught. There are still ways to do it if you dig into some research. Actually, you can ask for tips and ideas right here in this forum.QuoteI am in need of detailed insights and practical instructions. Also want to know both theoretical and practical aspects of the issue. Thanks for your contribution and for enabling me to understand Bitcoin better.Just reading isn’t enough to fully understand it. You should also check out some videos in youtube to learn the basics - they’re super helpful for getting a grip on the technical stuff. Think of these videos like mini-tutorials; they make things much clearer.

comments.author: Mia Chloe
comments.body: Well OP a whole lot of resource links have been put down for you here. First and foremost I suggest that you go through them . Secondly you should proceed to summarising what aspect of bitcoin you wish to understand and how deep you wish to go. Well for me I personally prefer to understand all the basics including simple economics everything about wallets open source softwares, decentralisation and basic things like protecting your coins and your privacy too.The most effective way to grow in my opinion is to do alot of reading and also try as much as possible to practice what you read that's the only way you can experience it firsthand and hardly forget it, remember they say experience is the best teacher. Lastly , make sure to engage in important discussions and ask questions as you learn. As for acquiring you can do that by rendering a service even on this forum.Good luck on your journey.

comments.author: Sanitough
comments.body: There’s a lot to cover, and I don’t want to overwhelm you since you’re still new. You definitely don’t want to mix things up. Start with the basics and gradually work your way to the technical stuff. It’s not something you’ll master in one day, but I’d suggest reading more advice here from different posts. That way, you’ll get a better sense of where to begin and how to move forward.I think the best board for this kind of thread you brought up is in Beginners & Help ... You’ll find tons of similar questions there, and maybe even ones you’re curious about too. If you can't move this thread, I'd suggest browsing through some of the interesting topics over there. I’m sure you’ll find something helpful.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: It helps if you follow Bitcoin discussions everywhere-- here on the forum, GitHub, Reddit, Twitter, and other platforms. Bitcoin-related news sites may be good but they are prone to report exaggerations, fake news, unverified information, and the like. It's one-sided as well, so it's better to follow the news on forums and discussion platforms. At the very least, contributions are coming from many community members. Users are free to counter, refute, contradict, rebut what's being reported. The veracity of the news is constantly challenged and verified. It also matters who to follow on social media platforms. For research and development and discussions on them, it's probably best to follow Bitcoin developers themselves. It's fun reading them debating against each other. Yes, there may be specifics in obtaining Bitcoin locally, so it's best to specify where you're coming from. Better yet, raise your questions and concerns in your local board.

Join your local board on the forum and relate well with them and they should give you a specific kind of guidance that will help you obtain Bitcoin seamlessly in your region.
